thread.title_full: Jaspers Battle Hard but Lose 2-1 to St. John’s Red Storm

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Jaspers Battle Hard but Lose 2-1 to St. John’s Red Storm
text:
Jaspers Battle Hard but Lose 2-1 to St. John’s Red Storm
The
Jaspers fell short against St. John's, losing 2-1 despite a strong effort. After a penalty kick by Macoumba Ba put St. John's ahead in the 21st minute, Ziv Dahan leveled the score with a header in the 55th minute. However, Miguel Diaz quickly restored St. John's lead just two minutes later, securing the victory. Both teams were eager to clinch their first win of the season, resulting in a physically demanding match. Manhattan's fatigue set in as they struggled to keep pace, despite a promising performance from returning players.
- Jaspers were outshot 9-6 by St. John's.
- Manhattan committed 19 fouls, while St. John's had 23.
- Manhattan's defense saw return of former MAAC Defender of the Year Nassim Akki.
- Junior goalkeeper Ludvig Malberg recorded two saves in goal.
Manhattan will take on #25 Seton Hall next, continuing their Big East schedule this Sunday. The Pirates are coming off a win against Albany and will pose another tough challenge for the Jaspers. The match will be streamed live at 1 p.m. on FloFC.Bottom Line
The Jaspers showed resilience but ultimately fell to St. John's. Key returnees provided a boost, though overcoming fatigue and tough competition remains critical moving forward. The upcoming match against Seton Hall will be pivotal for Manhattan's season prospects.
